column1: Vyatskiye Polyany (Russian: Вя́тские Поля́ны) is a town in Kirov Oblast
column3: located on the right bank of the Vyatka River
column4: 350 kilometers (220 mi) southeast of Kirov. Population: 35

column1: It has been known since 1596. A railway passed through it in 1915. Urban-type settlement status was granted to it in 1938 and town status—in 1942.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Vyatskiye Polyany serves as the administrative center of Vyatskopolyansky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the Town of Vyatskiye Polyany—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Vyatskiye Polyany is incorporated as Vyatskiye Polyany Urban Okrug.

column1: Vyatskiye Polyany is a town with economy centered on a single enterprise
column2: the Molot factory. The factory was active in machine building and was oriented to the military industry. In 2009
column5: it stopped. The salaries were not paid for months. The authorities initiated the programs of diversification of the industry and of reorientation of the factory.
